intro: Drosanthemum comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular ornamental plant in arid regions.
